alert.note: Alert for Butte; Custer (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 10:03AM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Idaho... Antelope Creek near Darlington affecting Custer and Butte Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pocatello. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Antelope Creek near Darlington. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding possible along stretches of Antelope Creek from the Grouse area downstream to the Big Lost River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM MDT Friday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...Creek levels should remain right around flood stage at least through the weekend. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Antelope Creek Darlington 6.0 5.9 Fri 9 am MDT MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
